author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tamil Nadu Tapioca Producers’ Association has urged the district administration to ensure that the sago units provided the reasonable price fixed for tapioca at the tri-partite meeting convened by the district authorities.

In a petition submitted to District Collector V. Sampath, the State president of the Association K. A. Govindasamy has stated that the district administration following repeated pleas by the farmers convened a meeting of officials, tapioca farmers and sago factory owners.

The meeting fixed a reasonable price for the crop.

Financial loss

However, the sago factory owners were not providing the price fixed at the meeting to the farmers, due to which the farmers had to suffer heavy financial loss.

Mr. Govindasamy called upon the District Collector to ensure that the tapioca farmers got the price fixed at the tri-partite meeting at least during the next crop season, the petition said.
title: Petition submitted
